description: Apply quality trade-offs to create thin slicing spine and later increments. Decide what quality the spine will have, what parts will be manual, what logic can be excluded, and how to prioritize adding quality in later increments.

do.description: Make deliberate quality trade-offs to minimize spine size

guidance.description: Start with completely manual processes in spine, then progressively add automation and edge case support in later increments
example: Increment 1: Manual Phone Setup - setup phone manually, activate phone through shell script, track orders using spreadsheet
Increment 2: Basic Web Entry - setup phone online using web form, activate phone through web interface, view orders in basic web page
Increment 3: Service Catalog - browse phone catalog, select phone and plan, automated activation workflow, order management dashboard

guidance.description: Use hard-coded values and stubbed integrations in spine, then replace with real integrations and dynamic data in later increments
example: Increment 1: Manual Order Processing - create order with hard-coded prices, manually approve payment via admin tool, generate invoice from spreadsheet template, send invoice via email manually
Increment 2: Automated Payment - create order with hard-coded prices, automatically process payment via gateway, generate invoice from spreadsheet template, send invoice via email manually
Increment 3: Dynamic Pricing - create order with calculated prices from pricing rules, automatically process payment via gateway, generate invoice programmatically, send invoice via automated email

guidance.description: Build bare bones forms with no validation in spine, then add validation and rich UX features in later increments
example: Increment 1: Basic Form Entry - enter customer info in plain text fields with no validation, submit form, view confirmation message with order ID
Increment 2: Validated Form Entry - enter customer info with inline validation, submit form with error feedback, view confirmation page with order details and status
Increment 3: Rich Form Experience - enter customer info with autocomplete and suggestions, submit form with progress indicator, view interactive confirmation with order tracking and actions

guidance.description: Repeat the same stories across increments with different quality adjectives to show progression from manual to automated
example: Increment 1: Manual Billing - manually create billing report, manually process invoice, manually send payment reminder
Increment 2: Automated Billing - automatically create billing report, automatically process invoice, manually send payment reminder
Increment 3: Fully Automated Billing - automatically create billing report, automatically process invoice, automatically send payment reminder

dont.description: Don't build full quality into thin slicing spine, don't skip documenting trade-offs

guidance.description: Don't include automation, dynamic data, validation, and error handling all in the first increment - that's too much quality for a spine
example: Increment 1: Automated Order Processing - create order with dynamic pricing rules, automatically process payment with retry logic and error handling, generate invoice programmatically with PDF formatting, send invoice via automated email with templates and tracking (TOO MUCH - should be minimal manual spine first)

guidance.description: Don't organize increments by completing one feature area at a time - organize by quality levels that span multiple features end-to-end
example: Increment 1: Order Creation - create order, validate order, save order (horizontal layer)
Increment 2: Payment Processing - process payment, handle payment errors, record payment (horizontal layer)
Should be: Increment 1: Manual Order Processing (end-to-end with manual payment), Increment 2: Automated Payment (replace manual payment with automated)

guidance.description: Don't use vague increment names - use names that explicitly describe the quality level being added
example: Increment 1: Phase 1, Increment 2: Phase 2 (WRONG - use quality-based names like 'Manual Setup', 'Automated Processing')
Increment 1: Basic Features, Increment 2: Advanced Features (WRONG - use specific quality names like 'Stubbed Payment', 'Real Payment Gateway')
